title: Print the Pattern
text: Next, we are going to do a simple activity in which we will print our output using Cout So, we can see 4 stars in this output which means 4 asterisks There is no space between these asterisks First, our first star will be printed, then second star, third star and fourth star So, we have to print 4 stars on the first line, 3 on the second line, 2 on the third line and 1 single star on the fourth line So, we have to print this using Cout If you have understood Cout properly, you can pause the video and try to solve it on your own or if you want to solve it with me, then let's start the solution So, basically, I can print this entire pattern using a single statement Let's clear this Single statement means that here First, I have written 4 stars After that, I want the next 3 stars to come in the next line So, we can insert the next line here After that, 3 stars, then next line, then 2 stars, then next line and finally a single star and at the end, we are giving the next line character If we write this much line and compile this code once and run it then we will get the same pattern printed So, we have got the pattern printed as it is So, we can do this with a single Cout statement and if we want, we can use multiple Cout statements For example, here I want to use one more Cout statement in which we are printing this much part This is going to be my third line in which this much part will come and this is going to be the final last line Let's save this as well and let's try to Ok See, if we miss a statement terminator or make any mistake then we will have the same kind of errors which our compiler will generate So, let's save it and we will compile it again dot slash a dot out So, this way our output will be printed
